author: Lancelloti
description:
Download Opera completely free through this link https://opr.as/12-Opera-browser-lancelloti  and support the channel :)



Have you ever wondered why movies today look the way they do? Well, it all goes back to one man: Robert Zemeckis.

Most people know him for the classics we all grew up with—we’re talking about the Back to the Future trilogy and the absolute heart of Forrest Gump. Those movies were massive hits, but Zemeckis wasn't done yet. He wanted to try something that most directors thought was impossible at the time.

In this video, we’re diving into how he shifted from live-action hits to a total obsession with performance capture animation.

You know the style—where actors wear those funny suits with dots all over them to bring digital characters to life? It all really started with The Polar Express. We’ll take a look at his "antecedents" (where he started) and then walk through all his big swings in animation, from the action in Beowulf to the holiday magic of Jim Carrey’s
title: When a screen test changed cinema forever
